Exploratory approach

These articles describe how to explore underlying heterogeneity.

Weibull-Weibull-Positive Stable

Marginalized-Weibull-Two Point (fixed mean 1)
Marginalized-Weibull-Two Point (unconstrained mean)

1α\frac{1}{\alpha} approach Fay et al. (2025) supporting materials

()In progress) In Fay et al. (2025) Vaccine Efficacy Estimands for Individual Randomized Field Trials, the 1α\frac{1}{\alpha} approach is used. In this approach which utilizes the “Weibull-Weibull-Positive Stable” model, the population (marginal) Weibull is estimated, and then 1α\frac{1}{\alpha} is applied to those estimates to render the individual-level (conditional) Weibull. This code recreates Figure 6 in that paper.

Fay et al. (2025) supporting materials

These articles show how to get confidence interval on underlying heterogeneity (in progress).
